text: George Franklin Gilder (; born November 29, 1939) is an American investor, writer, economist, and technology enthusiast. He was born in New York City. Gilder is the co-founder of the Discovery Institute. His 1981 international bestseller Wealth and Poverty created a supporting case for supply-side economics and capitalism during the early months of the Reagan administration. He is a critic of feminism. ==References== ==Other websites== * George Gilder's Gilder Technology Report * Gilder Publishing, LLC * Category:1939 births Category:Living people Category:Antifeminism Category:American political writers Category:American economists Category:Writers from New York City
title: George Gilder
